main event: Three solid, metallic objects were observed moving at a high rate of speed and maneuvering sharply over West Nyack, New York on November 21, 1963.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be solid, sharply outlined, and metallic in color.
The objects maneuvered at an estimated speed of 500 mph, passing through a 45 degree arc in about 5 seconds.
The objects were tracked on radar, indicating they were 'solid bodies' in the sky.
The witness could not estimate the distance or size of the objects, but stated they appeared to be 400-500 feet away.
The objects were observed for several minutes before disappearing from the radar scope.
sighted object: Three metallic, solid objects in the sky
